SpoonRPC
 
[hide private]
[frames] | no frames]
[ Module Hierarchy | Class Hierarchy ]

Class Hierarchy

  • exceptions.Exception: Common base class for all exceptions.
    • spoon.transports.TransportException
    • spoon.routing.meshrouter.RoutingProtocolError
      • spoon.routing.meshrouter.NodeUnreachable: Raised when trying to send to a node that is not currently reachable.
    • spoon.ber.BERException
  • object: The most base type
    • spoon.messaging.Messaging: This is the main messaging class that implements the basic functionality for Spoon.
      • spoon.messaging.SingletonMessaging: For convinience this is a singleton version of the Messaging system.
    • spoon.ber.zencoder
    • spoon.ber.stream.CountingFile
    • spoon.routing.meshrouter.MeshRouter: This class handles LMTYPE_NETWORK messages and LMTYPE_NETWORK_PROTO messages.
    • spoon.transports.LinkMessage: Link message is the wrapper which will contain messages sent between two directly connected nodes.
    • spoon.ber.BERStream: FIXME docs
    • spoon.routing.meshrouter.NetMessage: NetMessage is the protocol unit for the networking component of spoon.
    • dict: dict() -> new empty dictionary.
      • spoon.spooncore.LazyDict
    • spoon.spooncore.Memoizer: Used as a substitute for the file object when serializing Serial objects, so reference cycles are caught and handled.
    • spoon.serialprop: When used like a property in a Serial class, it will act as a flag to the serializer that only properties that are of type serialprop or lazyprop are to be serialized.
    • spoon.ber.decoder
    • spoon.ber.encoder
    • threading._Verbose
      • threading.Thread
        • spoon.transports.spoontransport.SpoonTransportThread
    • spoon.Serial
      • spoon.transports.SpoonRPCHello: This object is sent as a very simple form of initial negotiation.
    • spoon.transports.TransportHub: Where all of your transports connect to form your glorious new node.
    • spoon.transports.SpoonTransport: The spoon transport base class.
    • spoon.spooncore.SpoonData
    • spoon.NullLogger: Dummy logging object.
    • spoon.messaging.receive: The receive decorator can be used to decorate functions and static methods (NOT methods of class instances) that should receive messages of a given type.
    • spoon.ber.Tag: Representation of the header of an ASN.1 object.
    • spoon.spoonstream.SocketFile: Simple wrapper around a socket like object that pretends to be a file.
    • spoon.SpoonStream: SpoonStream implements an object stream.
    • property: property(fget=None, fset=None, fdel=None, doc=None) -> property attribute fget is a function to be used for getting an attribute value, and likewise fset is a function for setting, and fdel a function for del'ing, an attribute.
      • spoon.lazyprop: When used like a property in a Serial class, it will act as a flag to the serializer that only properties that are of type serialprop or lazyprop are to be serialized.
    • spoon.spooncore.StringIOWrap: Stupid wrapper around StringIO because it isn't a new style class.
    • type: type(object) -> the object's type type(name, bases, dict) -> a new type
      • spoon.spooncore.SerialMeta
